Class Encrypt

  • java.lang.Object
    • Encrypt

  • public class Encrypt
extends java.lang.Object
    This Encrypt class is a class that encrypts and decrypts a secret message. It takes in a secret message and a value "n" from a user. It takes the alphabet index and add the n value to the index. Then it will change the index back to the alphabet that corresponds to the new index.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static char[] alphabet
      The "alphabet" is character array that stores all of the alphabet.
      private char[] message
      The "message" is a character array that stores the secret after it is encrypted
      private int[] messageInInt
      messageInInt is an integer array stores the message in integer based on the alphabet index
      private int n
      n stores the value n which is the number that would be added to the alphabet index

      This is the constructor for Encrypt class.

        The "message" is a character array that stores the secret after it is encrypted

    • Constructor Detail

      • Encrypt

        public Encrypt(java.lang.String message,
               int n)
        This is the constructor for Encrypt class. It takes in two arguments. One secret message of type String and one n value of type integer.
        Parameters:
        message - the secret message of type String
        n - the n value to encrypt of type integer

    • Method Detail

      • getMessage

        public char[] getMessage()
        This is an accessor method for the instance variable message
        Returns:
        the secret message after it is encrypted

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        This is a mutator method that sets the message instance variable. It also checks whether it only contains alphabets. It will throw an IllegalArgumentException when the message has symbols and numbers in it
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be set to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the message contains anything other than alphabets

      • getN

        public int getN()
        An accessor methods to get the value of n
        Returns:
        the value of n

      • setN

        public void setN(int n)
        A mutator method to set n.
        Parameters:
        n - the value of n to be set

      • decrypt

        public void decrypt()
        A method that decrpts the message after it has been encrypted. It uses the n value stored in the n instance variable and calls the static methods to decrypt it

      • isAlpha

        public static boolean isAlpha(java.lang.String checkMessage)
        This method validate the message to contain only alphabets.
        Parameters:
        checkMessage -
        Returns:
        true if contain only alphabets and spaces. false if contain besides alphabets

      • getAlphabetIndex

        private static int[] getAlphabetIndex(java.lang.String message)
        This static method gets the alphabet index from the message.
        Parameters:
        message - the secret message
        Returns:
        an integer array that contains the secret message in its index

      • convertIntToChar

        private static char[] convertIntToChar(int[] messageInInteger)
        This static method converts a message in integers to alphabets using the alphabet's instance variables.
        Parameters:
        messageInInteger - the message in integers after encryption
        Returns:
        a character array of the encrypted message

      • addNValue

        private static int[] addNValue(int[] messageAsInt,
                               int n)
        This static methods accepts two arguments; an integer array that contains the message and an n value. This methods does the encryption by adding the n value to every element in the integer array
        Parameters:
        messageAsInt - the message to be encrypted in integers
        n - the n value to be added to the message
        Returns:
        the encrypted message in integers

      • subtractNValue

        private int[] subtractNValue(int[] messageAsInt,
                             int n)
        This method accepts two arguments; an integer array that contains the message to be decrypted and an n value. This methods does the decryption by subtracting the n value to every element in the integer array
        Parameters:
        messageAsInt - the message to be decrypted in an integer array
        n - the n value to be subtracted from the message
        Returns:
        the decrypted message

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method override the Objects toString method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string of the message.
